docTitle.titlePart:
Electrocatalytic reduction of 0 2 and CO 2 with electropolymerized films
of polypyrrole cobalt(II) Schiff-base complexes

byline.docAuthor: J. Losada a,*, I. del Peso a, L. Beyer b, j. Hartung c, V. Fernfindez c, M. M6bius b

byline.affiliation: a Departamento Ingenieria Qulmica Industrial, ETS Ing. lndustriales, Universidad Polit~cnica Madrid,
b lnstitut fiir Anorganische Chemie, Universitlit Leipzig,
c Departamento de Qulmica lnorg,~nica, UniversidadAut6noma de Madrid,

front.note: Received 14 February 1995; in revised form 16 May 1995
front.div:
Abstract
The synthesis of 2-(3-pyrrole-l-yl-propylimino-methyl)-phenol (LH) and its cobalt complex (CoL 2) are described. Electrochemical
oxidation of CoL 2 in acetonitrile produces a conducting polymeric film at the electrode surface. The polymer films are catalytically active
in the electroreduction of both oxygen and CO 2. In the case of oxygen both the electrocatalytic activity of the electropolymerized films
and the predominant product were dependent on the surface coverage.
front.keyword: Keywords: Oxygen; Electrocatalytic reduction; Electropolymerized films; Schiff-base complexes
